Issues.Title: Strange behavior of FormGroup in custom control
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I created my own custom control, which slightly changes the behavior of DatePicker from Angular material.
Inside the custom component, I use FormGroup to store the Start and End controls.
The main problem arose in the writeValue method.
Inside this method there is a code that sets a new state for the internal form and when calling patchValue with emitEvent: false parameter. But it doesn't work as expected.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-lsrf8q

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Steps to reproduce:

1. Select any date in Datepicker
2. Click the Set custom date range button

I expect that when clicking on the button in the console, only one line '#-write_value' will be output.
In addition to the string '#-write_value', the string '#-selected_date' is also output, which is very strange, because I set the flag emitEvent: false
```

Issues.Title: Use of input transformation is not considered in Angular language service
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Hi ! If you use `transform` on an `@Input` and having Angular Language Service enabled on VSCode you get an error from the template telling that string cannot be affected to the desired type (boolean for instance). In fact, it only work if you mark your input as potential `String` but it may be not wanted. ```ts @Component({ selector: 'app-child', standalone: true, imports: [CommonModule], template: `
{{ disabled | json }}
`, }) export class ChildComponent { @Input({ transform: booleanAttribute }) disabled = false; } @Component({ selector: 'app-host', standalone: true, imports: [ChildComponent], template: ``, // <--- Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.ngtsc(2322) }) export class HostComponent {} ``` You will not get any error on the provided Stackblitz as it doesn't use ALS. You have to download the project and open it on VSCode. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-u5b5z4?file=src%2Fmain.ts ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true Type 'string' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.ngtsc(2322) ``` ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 16.1.4 Node: 18.16.0 Package Manager: npm 9.7.2 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 16.1.4 ... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core ... elements, forms, material, material-date-fns-adapter ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1601.4 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.1.4 @angular-devkit/core 16.1.4 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.1.4 @schematics/angular 16.1.4 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.1.6 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: booleanAttribute transform functions yields incorrect results for `'null'` and `'undefined'`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

As part of angular 16, we have a few predefined transform functions we're provided as ready to use. 

booleanAttribute returning the result as **true** for null and undefined for value property.

Is there any specific reason for not having a double equal operator check for null in booleanAttribute function, as well as check for undefined as well.


export function booleanAttribute(value: unknown): boolean {
  return typeof value === 'boolean' ? value : (**value !== null** && value !== 'false');
}

Issues.Title: fix(http): Run fetch request outside the angular zone
Issues.Body:
Having the request run in the angular zone has the consequence of triggering the CD for every read of the response stream.

This commit wraps the whole `doRequest` to run outside angular with every callback on the observer being called inside the zone.

Fixes #50979.

Issues.Title: standalone component forward ref breaks when compiled as library export
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?
```
{
        "dependencies": {
		"@angular/animations": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/common": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/compiler": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/core": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/forms": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/material": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/platform-browser": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/router": "^16.1.3",
		"crypto-js": "^4.1.1",
		"lodash-es": "^4.17.21",
		"perfect-scrollbar": "^1.5.5",
		"rxjs": "^7.8.1",
		"tslib": "^2.6.0",
		"zone.js": "^0.13.1"
	},
	"devDependencies": {
		"@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/cli": "^16.1.3",
		"@angular/compiler-cli": "^16.1.3",
		"@tailwindcss/aspect-ratio": "^0.4.2",
		"@tailwindcss/typography": "^0.5.9",
		"@types/chroma-js": "^2.4.0",
		"@types/crypto-js": "^4.1.1",
		"@types/highlight.js": "^10.1.0",
		"@types/lodash-es": "^4.17.7",
		"autoprefixer": "^10.4.14",
		"chroma-js": "^2.4.2",
		"ng-packagr": "^16.1.0",
		"postcss": "^8.4.25",
		"tailwindcss": "^3.3.2",
		"typescript": "^5.1.6"
	}
}
```

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I have create an angular library called @ngx-ontrial/layout

its purpose is to define multiple layouts for our organization to use. When the layout changes, so will the projects within the organization. 

When the code is referenced and defined within my sandbox project. It works no problem. 

However, when I copy the code to a library, build and reference it from the sandbox environment, it gives the following error:

`Uncaught ReferenceError: Cannot access 'OntrialVerticalNavigationCollapsableItemComponent' before initialization`

The error links to the follow:
```
@Component({
	selector: 'ontrial-vertical-navigation-group-item',
	templateUrl: './group.component.html',
	changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
	standalone: true,
	imports: [NgClass, NgIf, MatIconModule, NgFor, OntrialVerticalNavigationBasicItemComponent, OntrialVerticalNavigationCollapsableItemComponent, OntrialVerticalNavigationDividerItemComponent, forwardRef(() => OntrialVerticalNavigationGroupItemComponent), OntrialVerticalNavigationSpacerItemComponent],
})
export class OntrialVerticalNavigationGroupItemComponent
```

Here is the component it is trying to reference:

```
@Component({
	selector: 'ontrial-vertical-navigation-collapsable-item',
	templateUrl: './collapsable.component.html',
	animations: ontrialAnimations,
	changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
	standalone: true,
	imports: [NgClass, MatTooltipModule, NgIf, MatIconModule, NgFor, OntrialVerticalNavigationBasicItemComponent, forwardRef(() => OntrialVerticalNavigationCollapsableItemComponent), OntrialVerticalNavigationDividerItemComponent, OntrialVerticalNavigationGroupItemComponent, OntrialVerticalNavigationSpacerItemComponent],
})
export class OntrialVerticalNavigationCollapsableItemComponent
```

I have tried looking around circular dependency and issues with initalizing the component.
I believe this is a bug as it works no problem within my sandbox environment. But when trying to compile from a library, it fails.

https://github.com/mills-andrew/OnTrial

Issues.Title: Interpolation should return undefined instead of null
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Interpolation should return undefined instead of null when trying to access a property of an empty object. For the following component
```
@Component({ ... })
export class App {
  o: any;
  obj: any = {};
}
```
the result of `{{o === undefined}}` is true
the result of `{{obj?.x === undefined}}` is true
the result of `{{obj?.x?.y === undefined}}` is false.
(See [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-rtrxpo?file=src%2Fmain.ts))

This is completely unintuitive and can cause bugs and console errors. For example, if I have the component
```
<app-fancy-component *ngIf="serverObject?.stuff?.displayFancyComponent !== undefined" [serverObject]=[serverObject] />
```
console errors are thrown when I'm trying to use the interpolation `{{serverObject.stuff.someThings}}` inside the `app-fancy-component`'s template.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-rtrxpo?file=src%2Fmain.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
"dependencies": {
    "rxjs": "7.8.1",
    "tslib": "2.6.0",
    "zone.js": "0.13.1",
    "@angular/core": "16.1.3",
    "@angular/forms": "16.1.3",
    "@types/jasmine": "4.0.3",
    "@angular/common": "16.1.3",
    "@angular/router": "16.1.3",
    "@angular/compiler": "16.1.3",
    "@angular/animations": "16.1.3",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "16.1.3",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "16.1.3"
  }
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

<details>
<summary>mrmlnc/fast-glob</summary>

### [`v3.3.0`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/releases/tag/3.3.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.2.12...3.3.0)

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.2.12...3.3.0

##### 🚀 Improvements

**Method aliases**

New methods (`glob`, `globSync`, `globStream`) have been added in addition to the current methods (default import, `sync`, `stream`), which eliminate the need to rename the method when importing. In addition, an `async` alias has been added for the default import, which makes it possible to use this packet with ESM.

**Method to convert paths to globs**

A new method (`convertPathToPattern`) has been added in this release to convert a path to a pattern. The primary goal is to enable users to avoid processing Windows paths in each location where this package is used by utilities from third-party packages.

See more details in the [pull request](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/392).

##### 🐛 Bug fixes

-   In the past, we mishandled patterns that contained slashes when the `baseNameMatch` option was enabled, which went against the documented behavior. ([#​312](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/312))
-   Several problems with matching patterns that contain brace expansion have been resolved.  The primary issue solved is when the pattern has duplicate slashes after it is expanded ([#​394](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/394)), or the `micromatch` package does not correctly generate a regular expression ([#​365](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/365)).
-   All negative patterns will now have the `dot` option enabled when matching paths. Previously, the `!**/*` patterns did not exclude hidden files (start with a dot). ([#​343](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/343))
-   The issue that led to duplicates in the results when overlapping or duplicate patterns were present among the patterns has been fixed. At the moment, we are only talking about leading dot. Other cases are not included. For example, running with the patterns `['./file.md', 'file.md', '*']` will now only include `file.md` once in the results. ([#​190](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/190))

##### 📖 Documentation

A [clarifying note](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/blob/master/README.md#concurrency) has been added for the `concurrency` option, which provides more detailed information about the Thread Pool utilization.

##### ⚙️ Infrastructure

-   The benchmark in CI is now running on Node.js 20.
-   The benchmark now uses the public package [bencho](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/bencho) instead of an in-house implementation. You may want to try this solution for your packages and provide feedback.

Issues.Title: Compilation error as a result of type missmatch when creating directives in all Angular 15 versions and not Angular 16
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

This issue seems to be only present in Angular 15 versions (I only tested it in angular 15 versions for now) and not Angular 16. The problem is with the `InputMap` type inside `ɵɵDirectiveDeclaration` type declaration. In Angular 15 versions, this `InputMap` value type is string`{[key: string]: string}` while in Angular 16 versions it can be string or objects like so `{[key: string]: string|{alias: string|null, required: boolean}}`. Now the issue is, it throws compile time error because the data returned as `InputMap` during compilation is mismatched with the expected type of string, because an object is being returned instead of string and Angular 15 versions expect string type for `InputMap` map value. As I see it, the issue can be solved either by changing the `InputMap` type to accept objects like the Angular 16 versions or changing the returned type to comply with `{[key: string]: string}` type for Angular 15 versions.



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/MurhafSousli/ngx-gallery/issues/563

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
node_modules/ng-gallery/lightbox/lightbox.directive.d.ts:16:84 - error TS2344: Type '{ index: { alias: "lightbox"; required: false; }; id: { alias: "gallery"; required: false; }; }' does not satisfy the constraint '{ [key: string]: string; }'.
Property '"index"' is incompatible with index signature.
Type '{ alias: "lightbox"; required: false; }' is not assignable to type 'string'.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Node: v18.12.1
Package Manager: npm 9.8.0
OS: window x64
Angular/common: "^15.0.0",
Aangular/cli: "~15.0.2",
Angular/core: "^15.0.0"
```


### Anything else?

Now I should note, I was able to solve this issue by tampering with the compiled index.d.ts file. All I had to do was change the `InputMap` type to accept types of {} as well as string. Eg:

`InputMap extends {
    [key: string]: string;
}
` to `InputMap extends {
    [key: string]: string | {};
}
` inside `ɵɵDirectiveDeclaration` type. 

Like I said, Angular 16 doesn't have this issues because InputMap type extended with `[key: string]: string | {}`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Compilation error as a result of type missmatch when creating directives in all Angular 15 versions and not Angular 16" (#50965)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ensure TS resolution cache with file replacements
Issues.Body: When overriding module resolution on a TypeScript Host object, TypeScript will not automatically create a resolution cache for the Host. Within the application build system the TypeScript resolution is only overrided if file replacements are used. A resolution cache is now manually created and added to the TypeScript Host when file replacements are present.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ensure TS resolution cache with file replacements" (#25520)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add `ssr` option in application builder
Issues.Body:
This commit adds an `ssr` option to the application builder, this can be either a `boolean` or an `object` with an `entryPoint` property.

In the future, server bundles will only be emitted when the ssr option is truthy, as unlike SSR, SSG and AppShell do not require the server bundles to be written to disk.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR " feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add `ssr` option in application builder" (#25499)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): only load browserslist in babel preset if needed
Issues.Body: The `browserslist` package is only needed in the custom Babel application preset if the `supportedBrowsers` option is specified. This option is not used within the esbuild-based browser application builder. The `browserslist` is now lazily imported only when needed and avoids the overhead of loading browser support data when not needed by the build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): only load browserslist in babel preset if needed" (#25519)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): filter postcss usage based on content in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, stylesheets that do not need any postcss processing will now skip the postcss step of the stylesheet build pipeline. Currently, only Tailwind CSS leverages postcss and Tailwind CSS is an opt-in feature. As a result, postcss will only be used if Tailwind CSS is configured for the project and a stylesheet contains one or more of the directives/functions specific to Tailwind as provided by https://tailwindcss.com/docs/functions-and-directives. This change should be most beneficial for component stylesheets which will rarely contain Tailwind specific rules that need additional processing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): filter postcss usage based on content in esbuild builder" (#25518)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Set chunk names explicitly
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Currently, chunk names are determined by ESBuild. Some libraries may resolve to a name that is not in a format of `chunk.hash.mjs`. This causes Jest to run over the lib files and fail as it contains no test suite.

Fixes: #25189

## What is the new behavior?

The change sets chunk name pattern explicitly so that all `chunk`s are exluded by pattern from running tests over.

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

I didn't figure out how this could be covered by tests. I did run a local build & installation and verified on a sample project that `@azure/msal-angular` no longer creates a "StandardController" file. Instead, it's named as `chunk...` and hence is excluded from tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): Set chunk names explicitly" (#25511)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): throw an error when executed in a google3-context
Issues.Body: There is a separate, internal version of the Angular CLI which should be used instead. Running this version can lead to unintuitive and unexpected behavior. This commit intentionally does not include an opt-out because there is no supported use case for running the external CLI inside google3. If someone is broken by this and presents a compelling use case, we can reconsider and add an opt-out for this check.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): throw an error when executed in a google3-context" (#25506)

Issues.Title: crypto issue
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

BREAKING CHANGE: webpack < 5 used to include polyfills for node.js core modules by default.
This is no longer the case. Verify if you need this module and configure a polyfill for it.

If you want to include a polyfill, you need to:
        - add a fallback 'resolve.fallback: { "crypto": require.resolve("crypto-browserify") }'
        - install 'crypto-browserify'
If you don't want to include a polyfill, you can use an empty module like this:
        resolve.fallback: { "crypto": false }

### Minimal Reproduction

while using 'ng run start' or 'ng run build'

_No response_

Issues.Title: esbuild: styles.css can't have import of npm (node_modules) style sheets
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

none esbuild

### Description

in my styles.css i have:

```
"~@ag-grid-community/styles/ag-grid.css",
"~@ag-grid-community/styles/agGridClassicFont.css",
"~@ag-grid-community/styles/ag-theme-alpine.css",
"~@fortawesome/fontawesome-free/css/all.css",

```

but that is not supported it seems, because i get:

✘ [ERROR] Could not resolve "~@fortawesome/fontawesome-free/css/all.css"

    src/styles.css:8:8:
      8 │ @import "~@fortawesome/fontawesome-free/css/all.css";
        ╵         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  You can mark the path "~@fortawesome/fontawesome-free/css/all.css" as external to exclude it from the bundle, which will remove this error.

also moving it to the angular.json file can only be done by having hard paths into it, which is a bit annoying because we have a nested structure of node_modules (parent,child) and then i always have to be really sure where that one is
so do i need todo 

./node_modules/

or

../node_modules/

it would be way nicer (in styles.clss or angular.json) to really be able to use ~ so the system just resolves it in a node_modules folder for me


### Minimal Reproduction

have styles.css (that is references in angular.json) with ~ urls

and using the esbuild builder.

### Exception or Error

```text
src/styles.css:8:8:
      8 │ @import "~@fortawesome/fontawesome-free/css/all.css";
        ╵         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

  You can mark the path "~@fortawesome/fontawesome-free/css/all.css" as external to exclude it from the bundle, which will remove this error.
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.1.3
Node: 18.16.0
Package Manager: npm 9.6.7
OS: win32 x64

Angular: undefined
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1601.3
@angular-devkit/core         16.1.3
@angular-devkit/schematics   16.1.3
@schematics/angular          16.1.3
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: bug(expansion): expansion panel breaks when quickly closing panels using keyboard commands
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When a mat-expansion-panel has tabbable elements in it's panel content, the mat-expansion-panel will break if a user attempts to quickly close and tab away from a panel after closing (easily reproduced using space + tab)

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/dgbfpa-3pq8m8?file=src%2Fexample%2Fexpansion-overview-example.html

1. Tab to the first expansion panel
2. Quickly try to close all of the expansion panels using keyboard commands (space + tab)

### Actual Behavior

The expansion panels are closed but in a broken state

### Environment

- Angular: `16.1.1`
- CDK/Material: `16.1.4`
- Browser: `Chrome`
- Operating System: `macOs`

Issues.Title: bug(MatTabGroup): Visibility hidden mat-active-tab is not removed when MatTabGroup and MatTabs are used inside MatMenu
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If we use MatTabGroup + MatTabs inside the MatMenu component, then in some cases the visibility hidden inline styling is not getting removed from the active tab. Refer steps or attached video for more details

https://github.com/angular/components/assets/92505353/7e512847-02ea-4d8b-9df8-f8da3cb1019a

Once the state has been reached, switching between more tabs can eventually 'fix' it, but only for that opening of the menu. Closing and reopening the menu can result in the issue reproducing again. A workaround, that is also demoed in the video, is to add custom styles, setting visibility to visible. Since the erroneous styling is applied inline, this workaround also requires the use of !important tag, which is fine for now, but not suitable as a permanent solution. 

I'm also attaching the link to a sample github project that I used in the video recording, for more info on how the code is structured. 

https://github.com/swapnil-verma-gl/angular-material-tabs

Addl note - While the project and the video use Angular Material v16, I can confirm that this issue is also present in at least angular v14, as that is what our actual project uses, and is where we first encountered this bug. 


### Reproduction

Stackblitz Link - https://stackblitz.com/edit/klkt9a-mfwvvv?file=package.json
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a component with a MatMenu and its trigger
2. Inside the MatMenu, add a MatTabGroup, with a couple of tabs
3. For each tab, add some content. This may be content directly inside the mat tab, or getting projected from another component
4. Now, open the menu and switch between some tabs
5. Close the menu
6. Repeat steps 4 and 5 repeatedly. Eventually, you will reach a state where the content for the active tab is not being shown. Refer video recording for more details

### Expected Behavior

Content for active tab is visible

### Actual Behavior

Content for active tab is hidden.

### Environment

- Angular: 14
- CDK/Material: 14
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTabGroup): Visibility hidden mat-active-tab is not removed when MatTabGroup and MatTabs are used inside MatMenu" (#27426)

Issues.Title: bug(selection-model): setSelection in SelectionModel does not respect compareWith
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using compareWith, setSelection method may deselect comparable items.
Cause is usage of Set and has method https://github.com/angular/components/blob/7c8a796294713c6f102885c94088a9c4713ffdd4/src/cdk/collections/selection-model.ts#L94-L98
This line https://github.com/angular/components/blob/7c8a796294713c6f102885c94088a9c4713ffdd4/src/cdk/collections/selection-model.ts#L94 could be replaced by 
` const newSelectedSet = new Set(values.map(value => this._getConcreteValue(value)));`
to use compareWith
### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-jfhnli?file=src%2Fmain.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. Instanciate a SelectionModel of object and non trivial compareWith function 
2. call setSelection method to select one object o1, selectionModel.selection should be [o1]
3. call setSelection again with a copy o2 of previous object (o2 must be comparable to o1 according compareWith, ie compareWith(o1,o2) is true)


### Expected Behavior

SelectionModel selection should be one of the selected objects, either [o1] or [o2]

### Actual Behavior

SelectionModel selection is empty

### Environment

- Angular: 16
- CDK/Material: 16
- Browser(s): no browser needed
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(selection-model): setSelection in SelectionModel does not respect compareWith" (#27425)

Issues.Title: build: add a script to detect component ID collisions
Issues.Body:
As of v16, the framework uses the metadata of a component to generate an ID. If two components have identical metadata, they may end up with the same ID which will log a warning. These changes add a script to detect such cases automatically.

Relates to https://github.com/angular/components/issues/27163.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: add a script to detect component ID collisions" (#27411)

Issues.Title: bug(DatePicker): Typing a date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format will format the date to "M/D/YYYY" but a day behind
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Typing a date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format will format the date to "M/D/YYYY" but a day behind. This occurs using the control in various modes, including the date range picker. 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce (can use demo on documentation page):
1. Render date picker with default formatting.
2. Type in the value "2023-07-06"
3. Lose focus of the input field.
4. The date picker changes the value to: "7/5/2023"


### Expected Behavior

I expect to see the date represented in a different format with the same date value. 

Value entered: 2023-07-06 
Expected result: 7/6/2023

### Actual Behavior

The date in the proper format, but one day behind. 

Value entered: 2023-07-06 
Actual result: 7/5/2023

### Environment

This bug occurs on the demo page for angular material: 
https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview

- Angular: v14+
- CDK/Material: v14+ (probably earlier)
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DatePicker): Typing a date in "YYYY-MM-DD" format will format the date to "M/D/YYYY" but a day behind" (#27412)

Issues.Title: bug(CHIPS): Empty getter throws error when used with NgFor
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Attempting to use a MatChipSet, filled in with MatChips using NgFor, and then attempting to access the `empty` getter in an adjacent element (eg to show an empty message), results in the following error:
```
ERROR TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'length')
    at get empty [as empty] (chip-set.ts:196:30)
    at App_Template (main.ts:19:9)
    at ReactiveLViewConsumer.runInContext (reactive_lview_consumer.ts:94:5)
    at executeTemplate (shared.ts:314:8)
    at refreshView (change_detection.ts:194:7)
    at detectChangesInView (view_ref.ts:72:4)
    at detectChangesInComponent (view_ref.ts:41:7)
    at detectChangesInChildComponents (view_ref.ts:88:11)
    at refreshView (change_detection.ts:246:7)
    at detectChangesInternal (change_detection.ts:125:5)
```
Best I can tell this is because the getter has no safeguards to prevent being accessed before the chips ContentChildren has been initialized.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz-starters-xwsleo.stackblitz.io
Steps to reproduce:
1. Access the stackblitz link.
2. Open the developer console.

### Expected Behavior

`empty` returns some sort of value.

### Actual Behavior

`empty` throws an error.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.3
- CDK/Material: 16.1.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(CHIPS): Empty getter throws error when used with NgFor" (#27404)

Issues.Body:
Fixes that the `empty` getter wasn't null checking the `chips` field and would throw an error if it is accessed before `ngAfterContentInit`.

Fixes #27404.

### Is this a regression?

### Description

If in a cdk menu, a sub menu is opened with ONLY disabled children, and then another sub menu is opened, that sub menu with the disabled children remains open.

Issues.Title: bug(Slider): Page Up/ Page Down buttons increase value but not by 10 steps
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

According to the documentation, the slider should increase the value by 10 steps when using Page Up/Page Down keys.
It instead increases/decreases by a different number of steps.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/17402311/ff4eced7-3134-4913-8a04-f086ebbc8f2c)
![slidermaterialissuepageupdown](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/17402311/38a787cd-dbe2-48b4-9847-4eed9b60eef3)


### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: 500 Internal server error for Stackblitz.... but the issue can be reproduced on the official Material demo
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to: https://material.angular.io/components/slider/examples#slider-configurable
2. Type '9999' as the max value
3. Use the Page Up/Page Down keys to increase/decrease value


### Expected Behavior

The value is increased/decreased by 10 steps.

### Actual Behavior

The value is increased/decreased by 1000 steps for max value 9999, 
the value is increased/decreased by 100 steps for max value 1000,
not by 10 steps, like in the documentation.

The step is not set, so I assumed a default of 1 x 10 = 10 steps.

Using the arrows, the value is increased/decreased correctly, by 1 step.
Happens on both angular 15 and 16.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.9
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Slider): Page Up/ Page Down buttons increase value but not by 10 steps" (#27402)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/menu): control + option + space not working on VoiceOver
Issues.Body:
In #26296 I added a condition in the click handler for menu triggers and menu items to skip clicks dispatched by the keyboard so that they don't trigger the menu twice. The problem is that this also ends up ignoring the default keyboard shortcut that VoiceOver mentions should be used to trigger the menu (Control + Option + Space), because it ends up being dispatched as a plain `click` event and it doesn't trigger the `keydown` event at all.

These changes address the issue by removing the previous condition and inferring whether the event will trigger a click by looking at it and the element it's coming from.

Fixes #27376.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/menu): control + option + space not working on VoiceOver" (#27401)
